blak3980

Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • blak3980.Rational

  • public class Rational
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines and stores a rational number in the form of a fraction numerator/denominator. Whatever the original numerator and denominator, the values are normalized by using their GCD (Greatest Common Divisor).
    Author:
    Tyler Blakeley 090603980 Blak3980@mylaurier.ca

      Constructor variant where the denominator is not 1.
      Rational(Rational that)
      A copy constructor.
      Rational(java.lang.String str)
      Constructor variable that parses a string to produce the rational.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rational

        public Rational(double coeffs)
        Constructor variant where the denominator is 1. (Thus, no need to normalize the number.)
        Parameters:
        coeffs - the numerator

      • Rational

        public Rational(double n,
        double d)
        Constructor variant where the denominator is not 1.
        Parameters:
        n - the numerator.
        d - the denominator.

      • Rational

        public Rational(Rational that)
        A copy constructor. Creates a new Rational object containing the same attribute values as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        that - the Rational object to copy.

      • Rational

        public Rational(java.lang.String str)
         throws RationalException
        Constructor variable that parses a string to produce the rational. Assumes a denominator of 1 if the denominator is not specifically given.
        Parameters:
        str - the string representation of the rational number.
        Throws:
        RationalException

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Rational add(Rational r)
        Adds a rational number to the current rational object. The new rational number is automatically normalized by the call to the Rational constructor.
        Parameters:
        r - a rational object.
        Returns:
        a new rational object.

      • divide

        public Rational divide(Rational r)
        Divides the current rational object by another rational object. The new rational number is automatically normalized by the call to the Rational constructor.
        Parameters:
        r - a rational object.
        Returns:
        a new rational object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Rational r)
        Compares the contents of two rational objects. The rational objects do not need to be normalized. (i.e. their numerators and denominators do not have to be identical, but they must share the same GCD.)
        Parameters:
        r - a rational object.
        Returns:
        true if the rational objects represent the same rational value, false otherwise.

      • getDen

        public double getDen()
        Returns:
        the denominator of the rational.

      • getNum

        public double getNum()
        Returns:
        the numerator of the rational.

      • multiply

        public Rational multiply(Rational r)
        Multiplies the current rational object by another. The new rational number is automatically normalized by the call to the Rational constructor.
        Parameters:
        r - a rational object.
        Returns:
        a new rational object.

      • subtract

        public Rational subtract(Rational r)
        Subtracts another rational object from the current one. The new rational number is automatically normalized by the call to the Rational constructor.
        Parameters:
        r - a rational object.
        Returns:
        a new rational object.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
